title: Digital Game Design Project Based on Elementary Mathematics Curriculum: Focused on Fraction Operations and Shape Classification

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematics education theory (operations and geometry), understanding of digital game development processes, and ability to express simple mathematical formulas
context.additional_context: Enhancing competency in designing math curriculum-aligned educational games in digital device-supported environments. Emphasizes verification of mathematical accuracy and pedagogical effectiveness when designing in-game calculation problems and geometric puzzles

learning_goals: Applying the five stages of the DGBL-ID methodology (analysis, design, development, evaluation, iteration), learners create a game design document (including formula-based requirement specifications, graphic storyboards, and evaluation rubrics) aligned with elementary mathematics learning objectives (e.g., fraction operation algorithms, shape classification criteria) within four weeks.
Development of a Game Content Design Document Reflecting the 2013 Revised Elementary Mathematics Curriculum (Calculation and Geometry Domains)
Prototype Production with User Testing Scenarios (Including Player Behavior Log Analysis) and Derivation of Evaluation Feedback
Implementation of an Agile Game Development Process Through Small-Group Collaboration and Iterative Problem-Solving
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
